Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the given coordinate system information: - Scaling: The 2D sketch should be scaled by the factor 0.75 (sketch_scale) - Rotation: Apply a counter-clockwise rotation around the Z-axis by 0.0 degrees, followed by around the Y-axis by 0.0 degrees, and finally around the X-axis by -90.0 degrees (euler_angles) - Translation: Move the sketch along the X-axis by 0.0, Y-axis by 0.2158, and Z-axis by 0.0 Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model: - Extrusion depth towards the normal: 0.2158 (extrude_depth_towards_normal) - Extrusion depth opposite the normal: 0.0 (extrude_depth_opposite_normal) - Keep the original sketch and perform a New Body Feature Operation (operation)</description>

Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75 using the sketch_scale parameter. Step 4: Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the rotation defined by the Euler angles and the translation defined by the translation vector of the coordinate system. Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal vector by 0.3125 units, and in the opposite direction by 0.0 units using the extrusion parameters. This will generate the 3D model for the first part. Part 1 dimensions and description - Shape: A three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly angled front face.
